headline.main: Joblessness In Japan Rises To a Record

lead_paragraph: Japan's unemployment rate set another postwar record in October, rising to 5.4 percent, as homebuilding contracted and prices continued a two-year downward drift. In a country where layoffs were once rare even in hard times, companies large and small are slashing jobs as the economy slumps and sales and profits erode. The government counted 3.6 million Japanese out of work last month, the most since World War II, and it acknowledged that the jobless rate is certain to rise further. Many economists expect it to top 6 percent next year.
abstract: Japan's unemployment rate sets another postwar record in October, rising to 5.4 percent, as homebuilding contracts and prices continue two-year downward drift; photo (S)
